laboratory_examinations.findings: Lesion (10 mm in greatest dimension) in the left T7–T8 neural foramen, causing mild expansion and remodeling of the foramen; consistent with a perineurial cyst.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Four months after the injections, a second MRI revealed bilateral T7–T8 neural foraminal cysts measuring up to 8 mm and smaller foraminal lesions at T10–T11, T11–T12, T12–L1, and low cervical levels.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Perineurial cyst (10 mm by 8 mm) at the T7–T8 level on the left side that became filled with contrast material.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Eight months before evaluation, repeat MRI revealed a perineurial cystic lesion at the T7–T8 level with 10 or more additional cysts between T2 and T10.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Revealed sacral cysts presumably causing sacral radicular symptoms.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: MRI suggested the presence of 21 Tarlov cysts.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Identified multiple Tarlov (perineurial) cysts with histological features characteristic of Tarlov cysts.
